{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3309480,"name":"Rocky","username":"Rocky_S","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rocky_s/{size}/220194_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-14T18:49:32.562Z","cooked":"

Hello intelligent people of FRC community!

My team is trying to increase the camera fps using built in opencv python functions.
The cameras should be able to get 60fps, but we are currently getting only 10fps sadly.
This is what we’ve tried so far:

    while True:
        cap = cv.VideoCapture(path)
        cap:cv.VideoCapture
        cap.set(cv.CAP_PROP_FRAME_WIDTH, 1280)
        cap.set(cv.CAP_PROP_FRAME_HEIGHT, 720)
        cap.set(cv.CAP_PROP_FPS, 30)
        cap.set(cv.CAP_PROP_FOURCC, cv.VideoWriter_fourcc('M', 'J', 'P', 'G'))
        if cap.isOpened():
            print("open")
            return cap
        else:
            sleep(0.001)

We are using ELP cameras and using a minipc on linux as our coprocessor
Any help will be greatly appriciated, thanks in advance!

Here’s some things my mentor wanna try:
" They were stuck at 10fps in testing yesterday, and they were in MJPG mode. After some reading I noticed that it might make a difference if we set the FPS after setting MJPG. Currently we set FPS and then MJPG. I’d like to try swapping those.
If that doesn’t work, we can try compiling from source."

Highly recommend you use cscore (pip install robotpy-cscore) for image capture instead of OpenCV’s builtin stuff, it works a lot better.

https://robotpy.readthedocs.io/projects/robotpy/en/stable/cscore.html

This is a secondary question, been years since I have used opencv for image capture (mostly use it for its morphology features now in the the geosciences)

How does resolution scale through the pipeline? Are you capturing at 1280*720 for April tags ? (Seems like that is the likely usecase).

For object detection (i.e. retro reflective tape) we could run things at really low resolutions and still get accurate results. Not really the case for April tags, but that is also not an area I have explored…

This worked out!
we have to set the MJPG first, then set the fps.
Thanks to everyone who helped!
